first.title: About the XRPL App Grants Program
first.textLeft: The XRP Ledger is an open source, decentralized and permissionless public blockchain. XRPL Grants funds open-source projects that advance the growing XRP Ledger ecosystem.
first.textRight:
We fund both core technology and end-user applications in key areas including, but not limited to:
  • Consumer use cases
  • Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs)
  • Core infrastructure
  • Developer tooling
  • Developer UX
  • Security

second.title: First Round of Applications Now Open
second.textLeft:
We will consider any project that builds on the XRP Ledger and involves some technical development.

Our focus area for the first round is to support the development of NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens) on the XRP Ledger.
second.textRight:
If you are interested in this focus area, see below for a few project ideas:
  • An XRPL-based NFT Marketplace
  • An XRPL-based NFT Issuance platform (minting)
  • Wallet support for XRPL-based NFTs

first.title: The XRPL Ledger
first.textLeft: The XRP Ledger is open source and permissionless, delivering developers powerful utility on a public blockchain. It’s an online system powered by a community without a central leader, and anyone can connect their computer to the peer-to-peer network that manages the ledger.
first.textRight:
Key properties of the XRP Ledger include:
  • Censorship-resistant transaction processing
  • A fast and efficient consensus algorithm that can settle transactions in 3-5 seconds and process up to 1500 transactions per second
  • An on-ledger Decentralized Exchange.

second.title: Partners Supporting XRPL App Grants
second.textLeft: XRPL Labs builds software for the XRP Ledger & tools for XRP Ledger developers. The flagship product by XRPL Labs is XUMM: a non custodial wallet and platform where developers, retail and end users can meet up to get the most out of the XRP Ledger.
second.textRight: RippleX champions the builders of tomorrow by providing the infrastructure, tools, services, programs and support for creation on XRPL (the XRP Ledger). With this support, an open community of developers can advance the solutions and innovation needed to allow businesses, consumers, institutions and governments to fuel the engine of a new digital economy.

content.q: What is the range of award amounts?
content.a: While there is no set range, we intend to award between $10,000 and $200,000 per project. Awards of $150,000 and greater are typically for developers who have already successfully completed a project. In general, the larger the award, the more scrutiny the application will receive and the more questions the committee will have regarding how the money will be used. All projects must include a statement of work that helps the committee understand how the amount of funding requested was determined.

content.q: How mature does a project need to be in order to apply for a Grant?
content.a: We intend to fund projects that have at least a rudimentary prototype open-sourced on GitHub. The minimum is at least 4-8 hours of work (e.g. a minimum viable product or proof of concept created over a weekend). We will not fund projects that do not have at least some substantial open-source component.

content.q: What types of open source projects will be considered?
content.a: We are happy to consider any open source project, including but not limited to software, hardware, firmware, design, and networking projects. All projects must involve some amount of technical development.

content.q: How should I determine what size of an award to apply for?
content.a: The award amount you request should be determined by the scope of work that you wish to complete using your Grant. Your application must contain a rough scope of work.
Projects should generally be released publicly under a license that is either a free software license according to the FSF or an open source license according to the OSI.

Generally any person with technical development skills or expertise can apply. Individuals and entities on the SDN list, other sanctions lists, or who RippleX is otherwise legally prohibited from engaging are not eligible to receive funding.

Recipients are responsible for determining the tax implications of receiving an award, based on their respective countries’ tax laws and compliance requirements. Amounts applied for should be sized such that any tax or other liability that will be incurred is accounted for. We reserve the right to use different payment mechanisms or tax characterizations for different awards in the program based on a number of factors specific to each award.

content.q: How can I learn more? Is there someone I can talk to about my project idea?
content.a: We would love to talk to you about your project idea or answer any questions you may have. Please contact us at grants@xrpl.org
